posts.post_content:
I should have a set break ready to go in less than two weeks.

The question I pose:


Would you rather have a lower price point, with less hits? ($55-$60)

Or

A higher price point, with more hits? ($65-$75)

Currently the lower price point has a hall of fame hit rate of 1:4.5 slots, the higher price point will be roughly the same, but would allow for a Demmitt ST Louis to become a hit among other higher grade (and rarer back) cards, such as a T205 Mathewson, HoF Cracker Jacks, M101 HoFers, etc.



Thank you for your consideration and help.

Sean
why not do a midpoint for 62.50 split the difference... up the hits a little

I would prefer the lower price point myself. Is it a complete t206 set minus the big 6? If so, the thought of spending $55ish for a possible Cobb but also a possible common is more exciting than the larger cost gamble and getting stuck with the same common.

[quote name="t206trader" post=1328182]I would prefer the lower price point myself. Is it a complete t206 set minus the big 6? If so, the thought of spending $55ish for a possible Cobb but also a possible common is more exciting than the larger cost gamble and getting stuck with the same common.[/QUOTE]

I am still deciding on the size of the break. I wanted to do it similar to the 1954 break at around 250 or 300 slots, but if I up the number of slots then I do not need to up the price to put more hits in.

Any feedback will help, I would essentially pass the 'hit' cost on to the break - so if another $1000 card goes in and it is 250 slots, the slot price would go up by $4 each, but someone has the chance to hit a huge card.

It has been mixed so far.

Sean, I don't quite understand what you would be breaking up.  It says t206 break, but you also mention Cjs and a T205.  Can you explain what cards would be included a little more?  I would personally be more interested in it if it were to just stick to t206.

I vote for the higher price point!! 

& count me in!

[quote name="LukeLyon" post=1328198]Sean, I don't quite understand what you would be breaking up.  It says t206 break, but you also mention Cjs and a T205.  Can you explain what cards would be included a little more?  I would personally be more interested in it if it were to just stick to t206.[/QUOTE]


+1.  I am not sure I understand what you are driving at.

Mark

[quote name="cincyredlegs" post=1328251]+1.  I am not sure I understand what you are driving at.

Mark[/QUOTE]

Luke/Mark

As bonus' to the break I have extra cards I was going to throw in. A PSA 4 Mathewson T205, CJ Walsh, etc. 

Any non-t206 cards would specifically be big hits. It was recommended to me by a few board members to try a couple other big hits from other iconic sets.

Nothing is set in stone yet.

I actually can't find an O'hara, but do have the Demmitt, so to make up for some of the bigger cards from the set the other hits would be put in.

For instance I have 2 (or 3) potential copies of a Bat Off Cobb that can be put in, but am lacking green/red port.
Where do I sign up? :)

I am in for sure.  My vote would be for the higher price point to allow for the possibility of a bigger hit.

Thanks for doing this!
Ok, I get it.  I like the idea of throwing in some nice cards from other sets.

I would be in. I am for the higher price point but it would probably leave some out. So if I were you I would not go that route. Glad to see a prewar break. I didn't get in the '54 break and really glad I was out of town. I have NO interest in post war stuff.
Sean, would these be graded examples/raw?
Ok I guess I will be the jerk and ask. Is this being done as a fun break like the 54 Topps set with full disclosure or is this being done to sell a lot of cards at a profit?

[quote name="oldcardboard" post=1328421]Sean, would these be graded examples/raw?[/QUOTE]

To avoid confusion with authenticity or grade, I have had SGC slab over 600 T206's for the event.

[quote name="bnorth" post=1328485]Ok I guess I will be the jerk and ask. Is this being done as a fun break like the 54 Topps set with full disclosure or is this being done to sell a lot of cards at a profit?[/QUOTE]

I have made sure to avoid the front sections and post in the BST.

Sean

[quote name="Sean1125" post=1328488]I have made sure to avoid the front sections and post in the BST.

Sean[/QUOTE]

So all cards are graded and it is a for profit break. Thank you for the info Sean. Good luck with the break. I personally am not interested only because I do not collect T206's.

Sean-

It is an interesting premise, but would you publish a list of what is in the break?  A complete set is one thing, you can easily find a checklist - but before I would say yes to this I would like to know what is in there.  You also mention there could be doubles?

[quote name="T2069bk" post=1328499]Sean-

It is an interesting premise, but would you publish a list of what is in the break?  A complete set is one thing, you can easily find a checklist - but before I would say yes to this I would like to know what is in there.  You also mention there could be doubles?[/QUOTE]

Yes, completely transparent.

Every card in the break would be scanned, a breakdown of what is there would also be provided. 

I am going to try and keep doubles to a minimum, but to fill out the break some will be necessary.

[quote name="bnorth" post=1328485]Ok I guess I will be the jerk and ask. Is this being done as a fun break like the 54 Topps set with full disclosure or is this being done to sell a lot of cards at a profit?[/QUOTE]

I guess I'm a little lost here...what's the big deal if he makes profit off of this?  With everything that goes into it, you better believe he should make a profit.  Not sure why it's a big concern :confused:

[quote name="bnorth" post=1328497]So all cards are graded and it is a for profit break. Thank you for the info Sean. Good luck with the break. I personally am not interested only because I do not collect T206's.[/QUOTE]

No problem at all, maybe I can include some T210's in the next break.

[quote name="freakhappy" post=1328517]I guess I'm a little lost here...what's the big deal if he makes profit off of this?  With everything that goes into it, you better believe he should make a profit.  Not sure why it's a big concern :confused:[/QUOTE]

No big deal at all. Just a valid question, if you noticed I wished him good luck and hope Sean did not take my question as being negative. 

Yes Sean you do it with T210's and I am in for a couple spots.:D

[quote name="bnorth" post=1328533]No big deal at all. Just a valid question, if you noticed I wished him good luck and hope Sean did not take my question as being negative. 



Yes Sean you do it with T210's and I am in for a couple spots.:D[/QUOTE]


I didn't think you were being negative, I guess I didn't see where your question was relevant. 

Carry on!


Sent from my iPhone using Tapatalk
I see these setbreaks as a win/win for everyone involved and hope Sean's is a go soon as im ready!
My set is done but I would be in for a couple of slots…Maybe I'd get an upgrade or at worst some good trade bait.

I think this event could also open the door to some t206 trading, something we don't see much of on this board anymore. I for one am definitely in at the right price with a ratio of about 4.5:1 of hall of famers to commons. If the price goes above the $70 dollar range I would probably sit out. I'd be very interested in seeing a potential checklist. Are we looking at only common backs or a mixture?

[quote name="t206trader" post=1328555]I think this event could also open the door to some t206 trading, something we don't see much of on this board anymore. I for one am definitely in at the right price with a ratio of about 4.5:1 of hall of famers to commons. If the price goes above the $70 dollar range I would probably sit out. I'd be very interested in seeing a potential checklist. Are we looking at only common backs or a mixture?[/QUOTE]

Mix.
I'm in. I vote on the lower price point with t206 cards only but I'll play either way.

I'd be in for T206s only as well and would probably buy a couple of spots. 

Brendan
Count me in for a couple of spots as well. If it means the chance of a rare back, go with the higher price point!! :D Thanks Sean!
Im in, if someone can help me with the paypal end of it. Regardless its prewar and sounds delightful.
Sean, please count me in.
I'm in.

[quote name="refz" post=1328674]Im in, if someone can help me with the paypal end of it. Regardless its prewar and sounds delightful.[/QUOTE]

I am going to open up payment methods the best I can. Any suggestions?
I only use money orders. USPS,priority mail or overnight.  I don't have PayPal.

[quote name="oldcardboard" post=1328702]I only use money orders. USPS,priority mail or overnight.  I don't have PayPal.[/QUOTE]

That will be fine.
I will buy a slot for sure.
I'll be in with either price point.

I'm in.  To the extent it matters, I vote for the higher price point.

Kenny Cole
I would prefer the higher price point but would do either.  Count me in.
Jeff, nice to to know im not the only one.
Sounds like fun...Count me in!

posts.post_title: Where can I find a complete checklist of this break?
posts.post_content:
Sean,

Where can I find a complete checklist of this break?  Since you are not doing a true set break, I would appreciate knowing what cards are possible before making any commitments. 

Best regards,

Eric

[quote name="Eric72" post=1329230]Sean,

Where can I find a complete checklist of this break?  Since you are not doing a true set break, I would appreciate knowing what cards are possible before making any commitments. 

Best regards,

Eric[/QUOTE]

Eric, once I get the other cards back from SGC I will create the checklist. I will also have an album with every single card in the break, scanned.

[quote name="Sean1125" post=1329353]Eric, once I get the other cards back from SGC I will create the checklist. I will also have an album with every single card in the break, scanned.[/QUOTE]

Thank you.  That sounds great.
I would be interested in one slot. I like the chance for a big hit.
I'm in.
I'm in.  Might have to limit the # of slots.  This break could go large in a hurry.
I would probably be in.

Sorry if this has been asked before; however, I have a question.  Is this thread meant to be a poll only or is it the one where you claim a spot in the break?

I would have asked via PM had I not thought others might be wondering the same thing. 

Best regards,

Eric
